website_summaries.verdict: A good, inexpensive deep-fry thermometer for home use.
pros: Features a 5-inch probe and clasp to hook to the side of your pot
Temperatures are easy to read and accurate
cons: Not the best quality, so some buyers had the thermometer break after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: They use plastic that melts on the face, melted on our first use at 380 degrees...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Terrible thermometer. The whole face of thermometer melted with first use.
customer_reviews.author: Brandonb

customer_reviews.title: It under reads the temperature if only the tip is ...
customer_reviews.text: It under reads the temperature if only the tip is immersed in the oil (like if you are frying with 1/2 inch of oil or so).
customer_reviews.author: guesswho3

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t read unless submerged
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended, does not work for your typical fries chicken in the skillet. The probe needs to be at least half submerged to read accurately. Merely dipping the first inch of the probe under reads and made me burn the first batch of chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works, but it's not great.
customer_reviews.text: It works. As other reviewers mentioned, you need to have at least an 1.5 - 2 inches in the oil to get a good reading, any less and it is off sometimes by 50°. The fact that it is only 5 inches long is it's only shortcoming. It does say that it is 5 inches in the description, so I can't fault it for that but it isn't really made well for actual "deep frying."
customer_reviews.author: Jenn B

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for cooking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace another thermometer that broke. The first thing I did was to calibrate it by measuring the temperature of boiling water, 100 Celsius, and right from the box it was spot on. If it does need adjustment, you can do it easily by turning the dial while holding the nut with a wrench. I've used this several times and so far it has done its job.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: Frying made easy
customer_reviews.text: No more guessing when the oil's hot enough. Always know when it's perfect now! Love using this thermometer when deep frying - it helps me get the oil to the perfect temperature. No more wasting time guessing or over/undercooking foods. The only issue I have is that I often fry in a mid-size pan so when I lower the holder it becomes top heavy and is easily moved should something touch it so I often have to avoid touching it with food/tong. But, can't really knock a star off just for that since it serves it's purpose. Wish I had bought one earlier!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well, allows me to hook it on the side of a cast iron skillet which I place on a Coleman stove so I can fry chicken out on the back deck and not smell up the kitchen. It is just right for me - and that is why I selected it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Used 3 or 4 times... No problems, thus far
customer_reviews.text: Used 3 or 4 times now... no problems, thus far... however, it does seem to be made on a low budget... but I guess you get what you pay for in this case. Not bad, just a bit cheap feeling. Also, deep frying at 350-400 degrees F is common and shouldn't be a "fire hazard" as labeled on this device... which I assume is overly cautious labeling for legal protection. Now over 400 degree F may start getting dangerous. Always have a couple of good fire extinguishers handy when deep frying at any temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hepburn II

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Junk. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a good reliable deep fry thermometer. It's not. It's a piece of junk that broke after one use. The point where the stem meets the gauge is weak and poorly-made. It flexes at the joint and the gauge soon breaks off. It actually arrived from Amazon (thrown loosely in the box with other items) with the gauge slightly bent. Just straightening it out made the connection even weaker. And after one use the gauge broke from the stem altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon43611

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect addition to the kitchen, allows me to have a much better idea of what's happening with the oil during pre-heat, between batches, etc. The "flash point" indiciator on the dial is only for veggie oil, and is not adjustable for wamer or colder flashpoint oils (canola, olive, sunflower) but the dial seems accurate enough for my purposes I can adapt.
customer_reviews.author: CaseyVR6

customer_reviews.title: It's fine at 200-212F but it did not measure anything above ...
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for me. It's fine at 200-212F but it did not measure anything above 300F, which means it is useless as a Deep Fry thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Tripp

customer_reviews.title: great for deep frying
customer_reviews.text: i purchased as a way to monitor the heat of the oil in a pan i use for deep frying, the clip on the side is the key and it makes monitoring the hot oil a lot easier that constantly having to stick a thermometer in the hot oil i checked it for accuracy and it is right on
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Lauderdale

customer_reviews.title: Mine is junk..
customer_reviews.text: Mine must be a dud because its terrible.. its way to slow to accurately get oil temps. Its literally 70F off during my heat up and when i toss something in the fryer the temp lags too much to be useful.
customer_reviews.author: D. Francey

customer_reviews.title: Comes in handy when using an electric fryer
customer_reviews.text: Some electrical fryers can vary 10 degrees from the listed setting knob. I have one such fryer. Using the thermostat on the fryer and the thermometer I can hit my fry point every time.
customer_reviews.author: Guy R. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Adjustibility makes this a useful product
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can adjust how deep the tip projects into the pot (up down), the direction of the thermometer face (rotate), and the location of the indicator for desired temperature (slide)
customer_reviews.author: J. Bryan Mccullar

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Was submerged about half an inch (same as I submerged an OXO Good Grips Chef's Precision Digital Instant Read Thermometer beside it). This King Kooker thermometer read 100 degrees cool, when compared to the OXO thermometer. Only buy this King Kooker product for the clasp. Then throw away the King Kooker thermometer, and use the clasp on a digital OXO Good Grips Chef's Precision Digital Instant Read Thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: George Huth

customer_reviews.title: Temperature varies
customer_reviews.text: I put the thermometer into my pot and depending on how deep I put it in, the temperature can change by as much as 15 degrees. Sometimes I don't have enough liquid to emerge the whole thing, so it doesn't really work.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle J Zigun

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I got it today, used it and threw it away today. I'm not sure how accurate it was because the plastic dial cover melted and rendered this thing useless. Instead of buying this item buy someone less fortunate lunch. You'll feel better about that purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was in bad condition
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows how my supposedly new item came, did not have paperwork with it and the back card was all in Spanish. The thermometer itself looks ok though. If you’re sending an open item to someone, don’t list as new, especially if paper work is missing.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Good Deep Fry Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Good product at affordable price. Easy to read. Easy to use. More importantly, your food will not be over cooked or under cooked if you have the right temperature every time you use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every home cook!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the first one I purchased, so I bought a second one for my mom. Oil temp does matter and can make or break a dish so I highly recommend having one of these around the house. I even use it to test the water temp when using dry active yeast for my pizza dough!
customer_reviews.author: M Mar

customer_reviews.title: Don’t WASTE your money!
customer_reviews.text: Thermometer is absolutely useless. I use it Side by side with another thermometer while I Fried 21 pieces of chicken at 370 degrees. This thermometer never went above a temperature of 230 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M.

customer_reviews.title: Glass case not sealed well
customer_reviews.text: On the 3rd use of this thermometer for cooking, the glass cover picked up so much condensation on the interior, it was no longer readable and the thermometer no longer usable. (The condensation does not disappear). This went to the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Larry G.

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the thing to stay in place
customer_reviews.text: That cheap little clip does a terrible job of holding his thing in place. I've given up on it and not use an instant read thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Quality is poor
customer_reviews.text: Broken after maybe a month or so of use. The accuracy was spotty as I compared it to a digital one, even calibrated but it didn’t hold for long. 2/10, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Unseld

customer_reviews.title: It work good
customer_reviews.text: Use it to check my own tempachure to test out accurateness on it but dont Reed good under ma tonge so put it in butt it red 109 so i made me go to the hosspital but they never no wats rong wif me
customer_reviews.author: LEROY

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for about the 3rd or 4th time over the weekend when cooking a roast at 375 degrees. The thermometer no longer worked ant the glass top bubble up. At 375 degrees?!
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.Shingles

customer_reviews.title: Pure Junk! Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for deep frying on camping stove. Face is "Plastic", not glass and both melted and bubbled up on first use over gas stove. Throwed both of them in the trash and went back to using my old Lodge one which still works. These are JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: WWDiesel

customer_reviews.title: Great product for testing fry oil temps after cleaning or repairs
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, we use it after every time we empty and clean the fryers or when the fryer gets serviced
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Plastic dial face is cheapy and easy to see imperfections. Design shows unnecessary temperatures over 500. Clip is thin. Numbers are hard to read. But hey $4
customer_reviews.author: Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality product
customer_reviews.text: The plastic that covers the thermometer gauge melted when we used it. Frustrating 👎
customer_reviews.author: Rlm

customer_reviews.title: Oops
customer_reviews.text: This is a warning to kitchen novices like myself. Most probably know better. Do not use it in the oven! My meat thermometer broke unexpectedly, so I stuck this in my chicken breast and closed the oven door. It melted in minutes. My bad:-(
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: works well.... seems kinda slow to ...
customer_reviews.text: works well....seems kinda slow to read the temp if you just stick it in the oil vs leaving it mounted...but if you leave it mounted it's too hot to remove when you are ready to fry.....and is not very well sealed....one drop in the oil and it had oil inside lol but still works
customer_reviews.author: Laura and Cory

customer_reviews.title: Reads Extremely Low
customer_reviews.text: Was getting ready to fry some wings and it was reading the canola oil right at 340. This was obviously wrong, as the oil caught on fire and led to the attached picture (more so Coor’s Light’s fault, rather than the thermometer), but the thermometer still did not work correctly out of the box. I’ll spend a little more money on a thermometer and less on beer next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: They hold on to the shallow pan well and work great. No grease fires, perfectly cooked fish.
customer_reviews.author: mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Got it because it was super cheap and super cheap is what i got. Had to do some research and get a different one that actually does what I need. Complete waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Carlin

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value. Worth the wait.
customer_reviews.text: Performs as expected in my deep fryer. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Bouvier

customer_reviews.title: Temperature accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read I use it for frying fish, chicken,French frys, hush puppies, Quail
customer_reviews.author: Lemuel G.

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my last one
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a little longer, but no other complaints
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn Bee

customer_reviews.title: Plastic lens melted during first use rendering thermometer useless.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic lens melted at just below 400 degrees during first use for measuring temperature of cooking oil. The melted plastic now prevents the needle from moving off that temp.
customer_reviews.author: Harpo

customer_reviews.title: A most have
customer_reviews.text: Very useful gadget. Fry fish never looked this good. Temperature is a key to enjoy a nice tasty looking fish
customer_reviews.author: Halzton78

customer_reviews.title: Get a digital if possible
customer_reviews.text: Item I received didn’t read accurately, perhaps a defective item- no matter if was boiling sugar or heating oil - gauge stayed at 100
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Just a little to short for the pan to wanted to use it on.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela T

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my King Kooker fryer
customer_reviews.text: My father-in-law bought us King Kooker fryer pan for Christmas this year and it was just missing a thermometer. This one works great to set on the size and still be able to put the lid on. It helps us to keep the temperature of the oil the perfect temperature for deep frying. The long handle is great for getting it down into the middle of the oil in a larger pan too.
customer_reviews.author: Bano

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product. Use just one time and it melt ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a good product. Use just one time and it melt completely. This item is useless
customer_reviews.author: Juan P.

customer_reviews.title: Works well and right-sized
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected and the perfect size for my fryer. I didn't think I would like the clip but I find in very handy to mount the unit on my fryer. Easy to read and quick reacting. The price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Largo

customer_reviews.title: perfect for meats and and candy
customer_reviews.text: No complaints for this product! works good and clips easily to frying pans.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: THE GLASS FOGGED UP SO BAD THAT I COULD NOT SEE THE TEMP
customer_reviews.text: THE RED TEMP MARKER FELL OFF IMMEDIATELY WHEN I MOVED IT. THE GLASS FOGGED UP SO BAD THAT I COULD NOT SEE THE TEMP.
customer_reviews.author: TOP DOG

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate temperature
customer_reviews.text: gauge shows 300 F is actually 350F, just a throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Paramed27

customer_reviews.title: the holder is great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and makes cooking safer for our family.
customer_reviews.author: splash

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: We use to monitor heat for our fried pickles and Mini Donuts for the Grand children Movie nights ...lol
customer_reviews.author: Ken M

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this thermometer in frying oil, milk, and to test the temperature of large cuts of meat. Very good so far. No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Maria H.

customer_reviews.title: plastic? really.......
customer_reviews.text: do not buy this - used it once and the gauge melted - it is made of plastic - who does that? oh, wait - its just gonna be used in a hot grill or oven so I guess plastic is a great choice - not...... can't believe that the manufacturer used plastic - plastic melts right?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Numbers are a little small without my glasses. Probably good for the average person.
customer_reviews.author: Outdors1

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I had no incredible expectations. This is a simple tool that simply works. I needed it so I could stop dumping chicken into oil that wasn’t hot enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Temperature reads 180 degrees in the unopened package. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Frederick G. Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Very Good cooking thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and very accurate. Used it to monitor the temperature of my peanut oil when frying..
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Plastic instead of glass lens. Cracked up after using two times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't use high heat (like 500)
customer_reviews.text: The gauge can't stand high heat, mine melted but still work.
customer_reviews.author: FarJang

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my 12 quart outdoor fryer. I’ve used it a few times and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I use this thermometer for deep frying catfish in my Cast Iron Dutch Oven. Attaches easily to side of the Dutch Oven and measures oil temp accurately!!
customer_reviews.author: fiddlinjim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Should always have one of these to make sure food is cooked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Doris Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Works great for shallow stove top frying pans!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for stove top frying in shallower pans. Would not work well if you needed a long stem thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Handy to use and the dial is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: PEN NAME

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't do well with high temps
customer_reviews.text: I only got to use this twice and the glass part melted.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha J.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for making sure your oil is up to temperature before dipping in your food
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: this item is very good quality, no issues with it
customer_reviews.author: R. Jenner

customer_reviews.title: UGH!
customer_reviews.text: i dont know what i did wrong the glass melted
customer_reviews.author: PGAL3

customer_reviews.title: Only worked Once
customer_reviews.text: Only worked once, second attempt to use it stopped at 300. Wasn't completely sure about it before. Go with the candy thermometers better quality my sisters has lasted 2yrs so far
customer_reviews.author: Nujackk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for deep frying U can't find the metal thermometer ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for deep frying U can't find the metal thermometer in stores any more all they have are glass with plastic clips only last one time
customer_reviews.author: Johnny l pittman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a little to short but thats my fault for mii measuring , Works great
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Branch

customer_reviews.title: Good frying pan thermomter, Nice clamp.
customer_reviews.text: Good thermomter so far. Old one seal caused glass to fog up.
customer_reviews.author: Grampa JoeTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Range is too small
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer reaches 350 degrees 1/4-1/3 of the way around. the units should read 350 degrees at 1/2 to 3/4 of the dial range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Really like the red zone being marked making it very easy to tell if the oil was to hot.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: I like this circular dial better than the flat
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I like this circular dial better than the flat, tube-type design that I also own. It is much easier to read when mounted on a kettle of hot oil.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon D. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These don't typically last long if you fry often so it's great that it's so affordable.
customer_reviews.author: lance

customer_reviews.title: 200 degrees off
customer_reviews.text: lucky I didn't burn the kitchen down, 200 freaking degrees off, oil smoking, temp says almost 300, pulled out the instant read, over 500!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon O

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to use in my dutch oven when ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my dutch oven when I was frying beignets, and the clamp worked really well to attach to the side of the pot
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not precise enough for my needs. It does what it does, as stated.
customer_reviews.author: William Jayne

customer_reviews.title: not great
customer_reviews.text: Not particularly happy with this. The majority of the metal needs to be in the oil to get an accurate readout. I was using a smaller pan and just never felt like the readings were accurate at all.
customer_reviews.author: Miko

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be impossible to find locally so I ordered three for our fish cookers. They are the perfect length, seem to be accurate and were priced right. I would by them again.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: face melted
customer_reviews.text: After about 15 usages, with max oil temp of 350 degrees, the face melted.
customer_reviews.author: Louie D

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice and it failed during the second use. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Painter

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Got water logged while cleaning it after using it twice.
customer_reviews.author: f.george

customer_reviews.title: It worked well, I just have to figure out ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked well, I just have to figure out how to use it and it not get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie McFerrin

customer_reviews.title: It simply worked as advertised which was important when I ...
customer_reviews.text: It simply worked as advertised which was important when I needed accurate temps in order to quickly fry 30 lbs of catfish in 15 batches.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Smith

customer_reviews.title: But should be fine.
customer_reviews.text: Fit right in the hole. Waiting for the weather to change a bit before I test it out. But should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: A Dollar Here & There

customer_reviews.title: Plastic melts
customer_reviews.text: The plastic lens melted while using it in a fish fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Eustis

customer_reviews.title: Stem is not long enough for my Fry Daddy
customer_reviews.text: Since the Fry Daddy has no adjustable thermostat and since some of my fried foods were cooking too quickly on the outside and remaining uncooked inside, I decided to buy a thermometer and decided upon this one. (Amazon reviews are so helpful.) I wish the stem were longer - it's supposed to be at least two inches in the oil and it made it less than an inch. Also, the angle at which is rests when it's clipped to the edge of the fryer (I like the fact that it has a clip.) makes it stand away from the side which interfered with the utensil I used to remove the fried food.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smaller temp gauge for my small frying pot. This works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Temperature off
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these and both were 30 to 50 degrees off.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond R.

customer_reviews.title: Keep your donuts from burning
customer_reviews.text: It's long enough for my pans and seems to record accurately, is eay to read. The clip is very helpful and stays where I put it. No more guessing if the oil is hot emough.
customer_reviews.author: amirthful1

customer_reviews.title: Best brand i found
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Works very well in my shallow fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Demel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well designed for purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the job. I use it when frying items where precise temperature control is key, like frying chicken or tempura.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kim

customer_reviews.title: M
customer_reviews.text: The glass cracked the 3rd time I used it so not very durable
customer_reviews.author: lona wood

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine until the dial cover melted during second use.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: This worked pretty well when making donuts in a pretty small pot....you'd have to have a lot of oil if using a large pot.
customer_reviews.author: shmjane

customer_reviews.title: Measures well.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for being sure water is 180 degrees for cooking shrimp. The holder works well on a WOK or pot
customer_reviews.author: Henry Bolanos

customer_reviews.title: So So
customer_reviews.text: Does any company make a thermometer that is not chintzy? This one is not water proof and after the first hand wash it is fogged up.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hastings

product_meta.title: King Kooker SI5 5-Inch Deep Fry Thermometer
product_meta.description: Color:Silver5-Inch probe. King kooker deep fry thermometer with clasp to hook on side of pot
